overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). The model prioritizes handling observed patterns like daily/weekly seasonality and anomalies while balancing complexity. After considering advanced methods (SARIMA, Prophet), it defaults to a simple heuristic averaging technique due to data constraints, focusing on interpretability and pattern replication.
common_data_patterns: Daily seasonality (lower at night, higher daytime)
Handling of missing values (not present in sample)
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex model applicability despite observed seasonality
Weekday/weekend differentiation is critical for pattern accuracy
Averaging same-hour data from comparable days (e.g., weekdays) handles daily patterns effectively
Rounding forecasts to match input precision (3 decimals) ensures consistency
Anomalous periods (e.g., constant Sunday values) should be excluded from base patterns
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines initial statistical model exploration with practical simplification. Features multi-step analysis (pattern identification, model comparison, heuristic design) but resolves to simple averaging due to data limitations.
